result.execSummary:
The defendant Savanah L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Early discharge at recommendation of agent if obligations fulfilled.
Probation my be transferred to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment/continue education

Not to consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs 
No contact at Home Depot - Kohler

Expungement under 973.015 upon; payment of fines/costs, no further law violations, successful completion of probation.  Request must be made in writing using form CR-266 to the Court and District Attorney.

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate
Continue mental health treatment and take medications as prescribed
Sign releases re: health care providers
